div.div: ἠμί : only ipf., η<>͂ (dixit), at the beginning of the verse, and regularly foll. by καί and a verb expressing action; ἦ ῥα, καὶ ἐκ χειρὸς χεῖρα σπάσατ᾽ Ἀντινόοιο, ‘he spoke,’ and drew his hand away, Od. 2.321, Il. 3.355; in slightly different combination, Od. 18.356, Il. 6.390.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
